pages.label: Introduction
content: With this Wizard it is super easy to annotate measurements of your experiment with ISA-compliant metadata according to FAIR principles.
Click on the Next button to start the metadata annotation of the results data of your experiments.

pages.label: Investigation Information
pages.prompt: Please provide the basic information of your Plant Phenotyping Project and when you submitted and published the Dataset.

fields.label: Investigation Identifier
fields.explanation: Identifier comprising the unique name of the institution/database hosting the submission of the investigation data, and the accession number of the investigation in that institution.

fields.label: Investigation Title
fields.explanation: A short title for the investigation.

fields.label: Investigation Description
fields.explanation: A text summarising the plant phenotyping project in more detail.
fields.example: The migration of maize from tropical to temperate climates was accompanied by a dramatic evolution in flowering time. To gain insight into the genetic architecture of this adaptive trait, we conducted a 50K SNP-based genome-wide association and diversity investigation on a panel of tropical and temperate American and European representatives.

fields.label: License
fields.placeholder: Search for licence of your dataset
fields.explanation: The license that comes with your datasaet

fields.label: Submission Date
fields.explanation: The date when the investigation data was submitted.

fields.label: Public Release Date
fields.explanation: Date when the investigation data will be publicly released.

pages.label: Author Information
pages.prompt: Please provide the Authors of your Dataset and define their Contribution.

pages.label: Publication Information
pages.prompt: Investigation - Please provide any publications relating to your experiment.

pages.label: Study Information
pages.prompt: Please provide general information about your study

fields.label: Study Identifier
fields.explanation: Unique identifier comprising the name or identifier for the institution/database hosting the submission of the study data, and the identifier of the study in that institution.

fields.label: Study Title
fields.example: 2002 evaluation of flowering time for a panel of 375 maize lines at the experimental station of Maugio (France).

fields.label: Study description
fields.example: 2002 evaluation of male and female flowering time for a panel of 375 maize lines representing the worldwide genetic diversity at the experimental station of Maugio, France.

fields.label: Start date of study
fields.explanation: Date and, if relevant, time when the experiment started

fields.label: End date of study
fields.explanation: Date and, if relevant, time when the experiment ended

fields.label: country
fields.explanation: Country of where the study was performed
